definition: a message expressing a belief about something; the expression of a belief that is held with confidence but not substantiated by positive knowledge or proof
name: view

definition: purpose; the phrase `with a view to' means `with the intention of' or `for the purpose of'
name: view
examples: he took the computer with a view to pawning it

definition: graphic art consisting of the graphic or photographic representation of a visual percept
name: view
examples: figure 2 shows photographic and schematic views of the equipment

definition: the range of interest or activity that can be anticipated
name: view

definition: outward appearance
name: view
examples: they look the same in outward view

definition: deem to be
name: view
examples: She views this quite differently from me

definition: look at carefully; study mentally
name: view

definition: see or watch
name: view

definition: the angle included by a photographic lens

definition: keep in mind or convey as a conviction or view

definition: optical device that helps a user to find the target of interest

definition: a close observer; someone who looks at something (such as an exhibition of some kind)
name: viewer

definition: an optical device for viewing photographic transparencies
name: viewer

definition: the audience reached by television

definition: optical device that helps a user to find the target of interest
name: viewfinder

definition: a transparency for use with an overhead projector
